children.name: mention
children.definition: to talk or write about sth or sb, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details : đề cập tới
examples: Was my name mentioned at all?
Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.

children.name: as
examples: I mentioned earlierAs I mentioned earlier, it will cost a lot of money.

children.name: it is worth mentioning
children.definition: it is important enough to mention

children.name: mention sth in passing
children.definition: mention something without much detail, especially while you were talking about something else
examples: She mentioned in passing that she had an eight-year-old son.

children.name: now
children.definition: that
examples: you mention it(= used for saying that you had not thought of something until someone else mentioned it )I’ve never been to his house either, now that you mention it.

children.name: fail/neglect/omit to mention sth
children.definition: deliberately not mention something
examples: I omitted to mention that I had not been to university.

children.name: forget to mention something
examples: I must not forget to mention how kind he was to us.

children.name: avoid mentioning something
examples: They both avoided mentioning John, though Anne longed to talk about him.

children.name: mention sb’s name
examples: Why does he look angry every time I mention Clare’s name?

children.name: to mention but a few
children.definition: used when you are only giving a few examples
examples: She had taken a number of classes, including photography, art, and pottery, to mention but a few.

children.name: mention something to somebody
examples: I mentioned the idea to Joan, and she seemed to like it.

children.name: mention (that)
examples: He mentioned that he was having problems, but he didn’t explain.
►Do not say ‘mention about’ something.Mentionis followed by a direct object :She didn’t mention her mother.
It is worth mentioning again that most accidents happen in the home.
It’s worth mentioningthat they only studied a very small number of cases.

children.name: refer to
children.definition: sb/sthto mention or speak about someone or something :
examples: We agreed never to refer to the matter again.
Although she didn’t mention any names, everyone knew who she was referring to.

children.name: refer to somebody/something as
examples: He likes to be referred to as ‘Doctor Khee’.

children.name: refer to somebody/something by
examples: The hospital now refers to patients by name, not case number.

children.name: allude to
children.definition: sb/sth formal to mention someone or something in a deliberately indirect way: ám chỉ
examples: She has often alluded to a secret tragedy in her past.
When the director spoke of ‘major problems’, I assumed that he was alluding to mechanical failures in the computer system.
Many of the ancient Greek poets allude to this myth.

children.name: touch on
children.definition: sthto briefly mention a subject during a speech, lesson, piece of writing etc :nói đến, động đến
examples: This problem has already been touched on in Chapter 4.
In my last lecture I touched on a number of important issues which I am now going to examine in some detail.

children.name: throw in
children.definition: informal to mention sth that is not closely connected with what you are saying, or that it is not necessary to mention: ngẫu nhiên đề cập đến
examples: He likes to throw in references to his days in the army.

children.name: to start talking about a subject
broach
children.definition: to mention a subject that may be embarrassing or upsetting, or that may cause an argument : đề cập đến, khơi ra, “đục, khoan”

children.name: broach the subject/question/matter etc
examples: I broached the subject of his past.
I was reluctant to broach the subject of payment.
He decided not to broach the subject of divorce until his wife had recovered from her illness.

children.name: broach something with sb
examples: I think Susan is being bullied at school, but every time I try to broach the matter with her she refuses to talk about it.
At some point we've got to discuss money but I don't know quite how to broach the subject with him.

children.name: bring up
children.definition: to start to talk about a subject during a conversation or meeting: đưa ra
examples: She wished she’d never brought up the subject of money.
If you think safety is a problem, I suggest you bring it up at the next meeting.
She's always bringing up her health problems.

children.name: raise
children.definition: to mention a subject that people should start to discuss or think about.Raiseis more formal thanbring up:nêu lên
examples: raise an issue/matter/question etc:
A number of important issues were raised at the conference.
The matter of whether or not the Royal Family should pay taxes was first raised in an article in the Times.
He promised to raise the issue with the Prime Minister.
They raised a number of points.

children.name: introduce
children.definition: to mention a new subject or idea before talking or writing about it in more detail:giới thiệu

children.name: introduce a subject/idea/topic etc
examples: She introduced the subject of sex without any embarrassment.
Then Meredith discovered that the way to get Harriet relaxed and talking was to introduce the topic of animals.

children.name: when sb or sth is mentioned
mention
children.definition: when sb mentions sth or sb in a conversation, piece of writing etc - use this in the following phrases: đề cập

children.name: make no mention of sth
examples: Nelson made no mention of his family; he talked only of his work.

children.name: get/receive a mention
examples: This type of research rarely gets a mention in the media.

children.name: deserve/merit a mention
examples: The village was large enough to merit a mention in the 11th century Domesday Book.

children.name: a brief mention
examples: Dillon makes only a brief mention of the idea in his book.

children.name: special/particular mention
examples: Mrs. McMillan deserves particular mention for all her hard work.

children.name: a passing mention
children.definition: a brief mention when other things seem more important
examples: There was only a passing mention of the event in the paper.

children.name: be worthy of mention
children.definition: deserve to be talked about
examples: This book is particularly worthy of mention for the clarity of its writing.

children.name: the mere mention of sth
children.definition: the fact of saying something that seems unimportant
examples: The mere mention of his name caused her to burst into tears.

children.name: mention of
examples: Hemade no mentionof his wife’s illness.

children.name: there was no mention of sthit was not mentioned
examples: There was no mention of a pay rise.

children.name: at the mention of sth
examples: At the mention of a trip to the seaside, the children got very excited.

children.name: reference
children.definition: when sb or sth is mentioned, especially in a piece of formal writing, a speech, or an interview: nhắc đến

children.name: make reference to sth
examples: Official reports made no reference to the incident.

children.name: Knowing what had happened, I avoidedmakingany referenceto
children.definition: mentioning
examples: weddings.

children.name: there is a reference to sth
examples: There are 32 references to eagles in the Bible.

children.name: a specific/direct/explicit reference
children.definition: mentioning something specifically/directly etc
examples: No specific reference was made to the race of the children.

children.name: an oblique reference
children.definition: not direct
examples: He added, in an oblique reference to the US, that ‘some countries could do more’.

children.name: a brief reference
examples: Brief references to the tragedy have appeared in the French press.

children.name: a passing reference
children.definition: one that you make while you are talking about something else
examples: He made only a passing reference to his injury.

children.name: frequent/constant/repeated references
examples: Medieval literature contains frequent references to insanity.

children.name: an occasional reference
examples: During the interview, he made only occasional references to his forthcoming autobiography.

children.name: reference to
examples: The poem contains references to places where the poet spent his childhood.
with/ in reference toformalused to say what you are writing or talking about, especially in business letters :
I am writingwith/inreferenceto(= in connection with) your letter of 15 March.
I am writing to you in reference to the job opening in your department.

children.name: make no/any reference to sthnot mention something, or mention something
examples: The Queen made no reference to the incident in her speech.
Did he make any reference to his forthcoming trial?

children.name: namedropping
children.definition: the practice of mentioning the names of famous or important people that you know or meet, in order to impress other people:
examples: I hate the namedropping that is a feature of most autobiographies.
I didn’t want to be accused of name-dropping.
—name-dropverb[ intransitive ]
—name-droppernoun[ countable ]

children.name: to repeat what was said or written
according to
children.definition: use this to tell someone what sb else has said or written:theo như
examples: According to today’s paper, 20 people died in the fire.
Rob’s got a new girlfriend, according to Janine.
According to Sarah they're not getting on very well at the moment.
According to our records you owe us $130.

children.name: quote
children.definition: to repeat exactly what sb else has said or written : trích lời
examples: quote from
He's always quotingfromthe Bible.
She quoted from a newspaper article.
Hequoteda shortpassagefrom the Bible.
sb is quoted as sayingtrích lời ai, lời ai được nhắc lại
"If they're flexible, we're flexible", the official was quotedas saying.
A military spokesman wasquoted as sayingthat the border area is now safe.
to quote sb
She worked,toquote her daughter, "as if there was no tomorrow".
quote sb on sth
Can I quote youonthat (= Can I repeat to other people what you have just said) ?
don’t quote me on it/thatsay this when you are not completely sure of the facts you are stating:đừng lặp lại chính xác...
I don’t think the company is doing very well, but don’t quote me on that.
quotationC2/ quoteC2 informal [C] a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing: đoạn trích, lời trích dẫn
a dictionary of quotations
a quotation from the Bible
quotation/ quote from
a quote from the minister’s speech
The book begins with a quotation from The Book of Common Prayer.
The following quotation is taken from a nineteenth century travel diary.
At the beginning of the book there's a quotationfromAbraham Lincoln.
attribute a quotation to sbsay that they are the first person to say it
The quotation is attributed to Chu Hsi, an ancient Chinese philosopher.

children.name: repeat
children.definition: to repeat what sb else has said
examples: Why do you have to repeat everything I say?
‘He’s planning to move,’ she said, repeating what Bobby had told her.
repeat sth to yourselfrepeat something, usually silently
Henry kept repeating her phone number to himself so he wouldn’t forget it.
repeat after me
Repeat after me: ‘I’m not going to waste any more money on lottery tickets.’

children.name: cite
children.definition: to give the exact words of sth that has been written, especially in order to support an opinion or prove an ideaSYN quote: trích dẫn, viện dẫn
examples: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.

children.name: to mention sb/sth as an example
quote
children.definition: to give something as an example to support what you are sayingSYN cite: dẫn ra
examples: Mr Jackson quoted the case of an elderly man who had been evicted from his home.

children.name: quote sb sth
examples: Quote me one organization that doesn't have some bad managers.

children.name: quote sth as sth
examples: He quoted the example of France as a country with a good rail service.
The nurses’ union wasquoted as an example ofa responsible trade union.

children.name: cite
children.definition: formalto mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation : dẫn ra
examples: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.

children.name: cite sth as sb
examples: Several factors have been cited as the cause of the unrest.
Hong Kong is often cited as an example of this kind of economic system.

children.name: not to mention
children.definition: used to introduce an additional thing that makes a situation even more difficult, surprising, interesting etc : ấy là chưa nói đến
examples: Pollution has a negative effect on the health of everyone living in the city, not to mention the damage to the environment.
He's one of the kindest and most intelligent, not to mention handsome, men I know.

children.name: not to mention the fact that
examples: It’s too far to walk,not to mention the fact thatit’ll probably be closed by now anyway.

children.name: as for
children.definition: sb/sthused when you are starting to talk about sb or sth new that is connected with what you were talking about before : thế còn
examples: Kitty’s got so thin. And as for Carl, he always seems to be ill.
You can ask the others, but as for myself, I’ll be busy in the office.
As for Louise, well, who cares what she thinks.

children.name: as follows
children.definition: used to introduce a list of things that you will mention next : như sau
examples: The winners are as follows: in third place, Mandy Johnson; in second place ...
The winners are as follows – Woods, Smith and Cassidy.
Most EU countries have signed the agreement and the US is expected tofollow shortly(= soon ).
